questions.question_text:
A HAProxy appliance has been deployed using a 3 NIC configuration.

Which network will developers and external services use to connect?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. I'm amazed when ExamTopics lists the right answer.

Selected Answer: B
Go with B, here's why: 

https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/an-introduction-to-haproxy-and-load-balancing-concepts

A. DMZ - No... who says we even have a DMZ? It's optional
B. Frontend - Yes, this is the part that takes incoming requests and sends them to the backend
C. HAProxy - That's the name of the product, not a network
D. Workload - This is otherwise known as the backend and it's the part where all the containers are that service the incoming requests (from the frontend!)

questions.question_text: Where are the virtual machine images stored that are used to deploy Tanzu Kubernetes clusters?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Content Library

Selected Answer: A
Agree. Content Library.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/vmware-vsphere-with-tanzu/GUID-6519328C-E4B7-46DE-BE2D-FC9CA0994C39.html

Selected Answer: C
C is correct. Content Library is only used to deploy VMware maintained images for the functional parts of Tanzu.

Selected Answer: C
It's C, here's why

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/vmware-vsphere-with-tanzu/GUID-6519328C-E4B7-46DE-BE2D-FC9CA0994C39.html

A - No, this is for the Vsphere Pods, not TKCs
B - You don't have to use Vsphere SSO
C - Yes (see doco)
D - No, these are the "resource containers", and can come after the cluster is made

questions.question_text: Which requirement is needed to deploy Tanzu Kubernetes clusters but is unnecessary when deploying vSphere Pods?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
DE. The others do not make sens or are incorrect for this configuration.
DE. The others do not make sens or are incorrect for this configuration.

Selected Answer: DE
I will go with D and E, here's why: 

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/vmware-vsphere-with-tanzu/GUID-D84AE530-B577-45E0-9DEB-FCD6B75308E6.html

A. Edge - No, wrong terminology
B. Backend - While this is a HAProxy term, it's not correct in the context of Tanzu
C. Frontend - While this is a HAProxy term, it's not correct in the context of Tanzu
D. Workload - Yes (see doco)
E. Management - Yes (see doco)
DE HAProxy is deployed with two virtual NICs (Default configuration), one connected to the management network, and a second one connected to the Primary Workload Network.

questions.question_text: Which two distributed port groups is HAProxy connected to when using the vSphere networking stack default configuration? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct.

I will go with "D", here's why

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/vmware-vsphere-with-tanzu/GUID-EE236215-DA4D-4579-8BEB-A693D1882C77.html

A. Assign vSphere Enterprise Plus license to the Supervisor Cluster - No, Tanzu is a separate license (which must be assigned or an eval license is used)
B. Change Kubernetes API Endpoint Certificate - No
C. Use NSX-T as the Networking Stack for Supervisor Cluster - Don't have to, no, you can use DVS. 
D. Enable vSphere HA and vSphere DRS in Fully Automated mode - Yes, this is required, see doco.

D. Enable vSphere HA and DRS.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/vmware-vsphere-with-tanzu/GUID-EE236215-DA4D-4579-8BEB-A693D1882C77.html

comments.content: This is not correct, Tanzu licenses are distinct and separate from the Vsphere licenses

discussion.content: A Assign vSphere Enterprise Plus license to the Supervisor Cluster

choices.D: Enable vSphere HA and vSphere DRS in Fully Automated mode
choices.C: Use NSX-T as the Networking Stack for Supervisor Cluster
choices.A: Assign vSphere Enterprise Plus license to the Supervisor Cluster

questions.question_text: Which action is required to enable workload management?
